text: Nostalgia?  For Super Mario Galaxy?  More and more the lyrics of Ben Folds ring true.  "Kids today are getting old too fast...they get nostalgic 'bout the last ten years before the last ten years have passed."
author: Eekiki

text: @SanchoKobe Well, I would say my Nostalgia for this game is mostly based on how Super Mario Galaxy kinda changed my life as someone who played video games. Before I played this game, the only games I had really played were Sports games and Licensed games, neither of which have aged well for me. Then I got Super Mario Galaxy for Christmas. It blew my mind. Never before had I ever seen a game on such a scale before. While the game looked and played marvelously, the Soundtrack is what really brings me back to the good times playing this gem. =)
author: Aegis29

text: +Eekiki and ? this is a bad thing to remember a game or a movie and it was 10 YEARS , people need to remember the good thing to keep going :) ( sorry for my bad english x)

author: Hal Emmerich

text:
Nostalgia
Noun

    A sentimental longing for the past, typically for a period or place with happy personal associations.
    The evocation of these feelings or tendencies, esp. in commercialized form.

Before you start berating someone, at least learn what the word means, nowhere is it implied that the feeling of nostalgia can be felt after a certain amount of time.

author: bushwhacker2k

text:
I like the way you put it. Melee does make the atmosphere dark and mysterious. Brawl fixed that. It fixed a few things and added a ton, more than I ever imagined would fit on a disc.

The one and only true failure that makes the game seem wanting, is the slower physics engine. If only they had kept the quick, edgy, precise action from Melee, it would have been true win.

author: Jonathan De La Cruz

text:
This would have to be the first time I've ever had nostalgia for a modern game.

Christmas 2007... I switch on my Wii, only a year old and waiting patiently for a truly excellent game to be put into it. The SMG logo rams itself right onto my TV as that beautiful music plays. "Is that... could it be? Is this game ORCHESTRATED?!

As I continue through the game, I find that I am right. The music is fully orchestrated.

I think to myself, "This is gonna change everything."
